code: @Manual{,   title = {extractNSEC: Functions for extracting NSEC values from fitted frequentist and Bayesian model objects},   author = {Rebecca Fisher and Diego Barneche and Darren Koppel and David Fox},   year = {2023},   note = {R package version 2.1.0.3},   url = {https://open-aims.github.io/extractNSEC/}, }

title: Functions for extracting NSEC values from fitted frequentist and Bayesian model objects
text: extractNSEC package extracts NSEC estimate supported fitted frequentest (drc) Bayesian (bayesnec) model objects. details see Fisher & Fox (2023).

title: Functions for extracting NSEC values from fitted frequentist and Bayesian model objects

what: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec

title: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec
code: nsec(   object,   sig_val = 0.01,   precision = 1000,   posterior = FALSE,   x_range = NA,   hormesis_def = "control",   xform = identity,   prob_vals = c(0.5, 0.025, 0.975) )

title: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec
text: object object class currently supported. Includes bayesnecfit bayesmanecfit returned bnec drc returned drc. sig_val Probability value use lower quantile test significance predicted posterior values. lowest observed concentration (assumed control), estimate NEC interpolated NOEC value smooth ECx curves. precision number unique x values find NSEC - large values make NSEC estimate precise. posterior logical value indicating full posterior sample calculated NSEC values returned instead just median 95 credible intervals. relevant drc x_range range x values consider extracting NSEC. hormesis_def character vector, taking values "max" "control". See Details. xform function apply returned estimated concentration values. prob_vals vector indicating probability values return estimated NSEC value. Defaults 0.5 (median) 0.025 0.975 (95 percent credible intervals).

title: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec
text: vector containing estimated NSEC value, including upper lower 95% credible interval bounds.

title: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec
text: hormesis_def, "max", NSEC values calculated decline maximum estimates (.e. peak NEC); "control", ECx values calculated relative control, assumed lowest observed concentration. current supported drc fits. argument precision controls precisely ecx nsec value estimated, argument x_range allowing estimation beyond existing range observed data (otherwise default range) can useful small number cases. also reasonable case estimating raw data value, functions simply return one treatment concentrations, making NOEC better metric case.

title: Extracts the predicted NSEC value from supported classes. — nsec
code: # \donttest{ library(bayesnec) #> Error in library(bayesnec): there is no package called ‘bayesnec’  data(manec_example) #> Warning: data set ‘manec_example’ not found nsec(manec_example) #> Error in eval(expr, envir, enclos): object 'manec_example' not found # }
